definitions: simple, unsophisticated, and traditional in character or style, suggesting rural origins
made or spun at home rather than in a factory
examples: His homespun wisdom resonated with the rural voters
She appreciated the homespun charm of the small-town festival
The museum displayed homespun cloth from the colonial era
Her grandmother wore a homespun dress to the wedding

definitions: going toward or in the direction of one's home or homeland
examples: The homeward journey took three exhausting days
Sailors sang songs during their homeward voyage

definitions: having or showing a tendency to commit murder; murderously inclined
extremely angry or violent to the point of wanting to kill
examples: The detective tracked down the homicidal suspect
Police warned residents about a homicidal maniac
His homicidal rage terrified everyone in the room
She felt homicidal when she discovered the betrayal

definitions: relating to an animal's ability to return to its territory or home
designed to find and move toward a target automatically
examples: The homing pigeons returned to their roost
Scientists studied the homing instinct in migrating birds
The military deployed homing missiles in the conflict
The submarine launched homing torpedoes at the target

definitions: relating to the biological family that includes humans and their fossil ancestors
examples: The hominid fossils revealed ancient human evolution
Archaeologists discovered hominid tools in the cave

definitions: concerning or arousing sexual desire centered on a person of the same sex
examples: Art historians noted homoerotic themes in Renaissance paintings
The novel contained subtle homoerotic undertones

definitions: consisting of parts or elements that are all the same or similar in nature
examples: The chemist created a homogeneous mixture of liquids
The neighborhood had a remarkably homogeneous population

definitions: consisting of parts or elements that are all the same or similar in nature
examples: The researchers studied homogenous cell cultures
The school had a homogenous student body

definitions: having or showing dislike or prejudice against gay and lesbian people
examples: The company fired employees for homophobic remarks
Schools implemented policies against homophobic bullying

definitions: sexually or romantically attracted to people of one's own sex
examples: The country legalized homosexual marriage last year
Support groups helped homosexual teenagers facing discrimination

definitions: free of deceit and untruthfulness; sincere and morally upright
frank and direct in manner or speech without deception
fairly earned or gained through legitimate work or effort
examples: She gave an honest answer to the difficult question
The honest shopkeeper returned the extra change
Let me be honest about your performance issues
His honest feedback helped improve the project
They made an honest living running their small business
She earned an honest dollar through hard work

definitions: having the golden or amber color characteristic of honey
sweet and smooth in taste, texture or quality like honey
examples: Her honey blonde hair gleamed in the sunlight
The wood had a beautiful honey finish
The singer's honey voice charmed the audience
He spoke in honey tones to calm her

definitions: bringing or worthy of honor; adhering to ethical and moral principles
used as a title or form of respectful address
deserving respect and admiration for fairness and integrity
examples: He made the honorable decision to return the money
She lived an honorable life devoted to justice
The Honorable Judge Smith presided over the trial
They addressed him as the honorable gentleman
Their honorable intentions were clear from the beginning
The soldier received an honorable discharge

definitions: given as a mark of respect without the usual requirements or functions
holding a position or title without payment or regular duties
examples: The university awarded her an honorary doctorate
He received an honorary membership in the club
She served as honorary chairperson of the charity
The retired professor became an honorary consultant

definitions: regarded with great respect and admiration by others
feeling privileged and pleased to receive recognition or opportunity
examples: The honored guest gave the keynote speech
She was an honored member of the community
I feel deeply honored by your invitation
We are honored to have you with us

definitions: given, used, or showing as a mark of respect or honor
examples: Japanese uses many honorific titles in formal speech
The honorific prefix was added to show respect

definitions: bringing or worthy of honour; adhering to ethical and moral principles
used as a title or form of respectful address
deserving respect and admiration for fairness and integrity
examples: He took the honourable course despite personal cost
She maintained honourable conduct throughout the scandal
The Right Honourable Member addressed Parliament
They referred to him as the honourable gentleman
His honourable service earned widespread respect
The company has an honourable reputation

definitions: shaped like a hook; curved or bent sharply
addicted to or very enthusiastic about something
examples: The eagle's hooked beak tore at the prey
He had a distinctive hooked nose
She got hooked on mystery novels last summer
They were completely hooked after the first episode

definitions: feeling or inspiring optimism about a future event or situation
giving grounds for hope; promising or encouraging
a person likely or hoping to succeed in something
examples: She remained hopeful despite the setbacks
The team was hopeful about winning the championship
The doctor gave a hopeful prognosis
Early results showed hopeful signs of recovery
The young hopeful auditioned for the lead role
Presidential hopefuls gathered for the debate

definitions: feeling or causing despair about something; lacking any hope
showing no skill or aptitude; incompetent or inadequate
examples: The situation seemed utterly hopeless
She felt hopeless about finding employment
He's hopeless at remembering people's names
I'm completely hopeless with technology

definitions: parallel to the plane of the horizon; at right angles to vertical
examples: The carpenter checked that the shelf was perfectly horizontal
Horizontal lines create a sense of calm in design

definitions: relating to or caused by hormones in the body
examples: Teenagers experience significant hormonal changes
The doctor ordered hormonal tests

definitions: having horns or horn-like projections on the head
examples: The horned owl perched silently in the tree
Vikings wore horned helmets according to popular myth

definitions: made of horn or a hard substance; hard and callused
feeling or arousing sexual excitement or desire
examples: The old farmer had horny hands from years of work
The rhino's horny skin protected it from predators
The teenagers made horny jokes at the party
He felt horny after their romantic dinner

definitions: extremely unpleasant, horrifying, or terrible in quality or degree
examples: The accident caused horrendous injuries
They endured horrendous conditions in the prison camp

definitions: causing or likely to cause horror; shocking and frightening
very unpleasant or disagreeable in nature or effect
examples: They witnessed a horrible accident on the highway
The movie contained horrible scenes of violence
The medicine had a horrible taste
What horrible weather we're having today

definitions: very unpleasant or disagreeable; causing disgust or dismay
examples: The room had a horrid smell of decay
She wore the most horrid dress to the party

definitions: causing horror or extreme shock; extremely disturbing or frightening
examples: The victims suffered horrific injuries in the explosion
Witnesses described horrific scenes at the crash site

definitions: filled with horror or shock; extremely dismayed or appalled
examples: She was horrified by the brutal attack
Parents were horrified to discover the school's condition

definitions: causing feelings of horror or shock; extremely disturbing or frightening
examples: The documentary showed horrifying footage of war
They heard horrifying screams from next door

definitions: relating to the art or practice of garden cultivation and management
examples: She studied horticultural science at university
The horticultural society organized the flower show

definitions: friendly and welcoming to strangers or guests; showing hospitality
providing favorable conditions for life or growth
examples: The hospitable innkeeper made everyone feel at home
They were known for their hospitable nature
Mars is not hospitable to human life
The desert provides few hospitable environments

definitions: unfriendly and aggressive; showing opposition or dislike
belonging to an enemy in war; relating to military enemy
examples: The crowd grew hostile toward the speaker
She received a hostile reception at the meeting
The troops entered hostile territory at dawn
They faced hostile forces on all sides

definitions: having a high degree of heat or temperature
containing spices that produce a burning sensation
sexually attractive or arousing sexual desire
currently popular, fashionable, or in demand
recently stolen and therefore risky to possess
examples: The hot coffee burned her tongue
It was a hot summer day in Arizona
This curry is too hot for me to eat
They served hot salsa with the tacos
Everyone thinks the new teacher is really hot
She looked hot in that red dress
That band is really hot right now
Virtual reality is the hot new technology
The police found hot merchandise in his apartment
Those watches are hot, don't buy them

definitions: happening or done every hour or once an hour
reckoned or paid by the hour rather than salary
examples: The bus runs on an hourly schedule
She took hourly measurements of the temperature
Most retail workers are hourly employees
The consultant charges an hourly rate

definitions: producing a loud, long, mournful cry or sound
extreme in degree or intensity; very great
examples: The howling wolves kept campers awake all night
A howling wind rattled the windows
The movie was a howling success at the box office
They made a howling error in their calculations

definitions: crowded together closely, typically for warmth or protection
examples: The huddled masses yearned for freedom
Children sat huddled together against the cold

definitions: extremely large in size, amount, or degree; enormous
examples: The company made huge profits last quarter
A huge crowd gathered in the square

definitions: relating to or characteristic of people or human beings
showing the better qualities of humankind such as kindness
examples: Scientists study human behavior and psychology
The accident was caused by human error
The guard showed a human side when helping the child
It's only human to make mistakes sometimes

definitions: having or showing compassion, benevolence, or kindness toward people or animals
examples: The organization promotes humane treatment of animals
They sought a more humane solution to the crisis

definitions: relating to a philosophy that emphasizes human dignity, values, and capabilities
examples: She taught from a humanist perspective
The humanist movement influenced Renaissance art

definitions: relating to or supporting the principles of humanism; emphasizing human welfare and dignity
examples: The school adopted a humanistic approach to education
Her humanistic values shaped company policy

definitions: concerned with or seeking to promote human welfare and social reform
examples: The UN sent humanitarian aid to the region
She devoted her life to humanitarian causes

definitions: having or showing a modest estimate of one's importance; not proud or arrogant
of low social, administrative, or political rank; unpretentious
examples: Despite his success, he remained humble
She gave a humble apology for the mistake
He came from humble beginnings in rural poverty
They lived in a humble cottage by the river

definitions: made to feel less important or proud; having one's dignity or self-respect lowered
examples: He felt humbled by their generosity
The champion was humbled by the unexpected defeat

definitions: containing a high amount of water vapor in the air; marked by humidity
examples: The humid climate made breathing difficult
It was a hot and humid summer afternoon

definitions: made to feel ashamed and foolish by injuring one's dignity and self-respect
examples: She felt humiliated after forgetting her speech
He was humiliated by the public criticism

definitions: causing someone to feel ashamed and foolish by injuring their dignity
examples: It was a humiliating defeat for the team
She endured humiliating treatment at work

definitions: causing lighthearted laughter and amusement; comic or funny in character
examples: His humorous stories entertained the children
She wrote a humorous account of her travels

definitions: amounting to or denoting the number one hundred in quantity
examples: The company hired a hundred new employees
She lived to be a hundred years old
